quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: So the figures show improvement right there, Michael. And again- [Pam walks in and shows Michael a note]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'll call back.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You never call back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Every time Michael's in a meeting, he makes me come in and give him a Post-It note telling him who's on the phone. I did it once, and he freaked out. He loved it so much. The thing is he doesn't get that many calls. So he has me make them up every 10 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Pam walks in and shows Michael a note that says "Good Morning"] Yeah, um, tell him I'll call him back.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [laughing]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can't always work 200 days though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Pam walks in and shows Michael a note that has a smiley face] Oh, no, no, no, I don't have time for this. Tell him I'm in a meeting. [Jan looks impressed]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: You have to know how to work this. There's no excuse for this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I can get you a tutor if you need- [Pam walks in and shows Michael a note with a waving, smiling Hot Dog saying "Hiya Buddy"]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh. Ah, this is a very important client. But, I have the most important client sitting right in front of me, my boss, so I will call him later.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Oh, no, no, no, customer service is obviously priority one. You can take the call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: N-No, money isn't everything Ryan. And you're my friend, and I don't want to be rude.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Take the call, friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I refuse. My house, my rules, I insist.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I insist you take your work calls.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, okay, all right. Pam, would you put the call through? [Pam pushes a button the phone] Hi buddy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I don't know, it's just, ugh, I never felt welcomed there, you know? It's such a...boys club.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, I hate that.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: So, here's the deal. Um, I am on my way to New York to be deposed as part of Jan's wrongful termination law suit. The company fired her for having the courage to augment her boobs.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: And they displayed a pattern of disrespect and inappropriate behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, yes. Pat-tern. Patt-ern. My friend Pat took a turn. That's how I remember that. Could we pull over and put down the top? I'm feeling a little queasy.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Um, no, I want it up. My hair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well-

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Remember, it isn't just a pattern, It's a pattern of disrespect, and inappropriate behavior.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Disray .My friend Disray got news specs. Disray spect. My friend Inappro drives a Prius with his behind neighbor.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Does this work for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yep. Tell them how much you're gonna get if you win.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Uh, come on Micheal, that's tacky.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Million dollars!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Four million.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Four million dollars! Man that is a lot of guacamole. A lot of the green. Lot of green. That is why I have memorized Jan's answers, and I have also thrown in some errs, and ahhs, to make it seem like it's not memorized.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: No, Michael. Oh, come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Perfect crime.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Stop saying ridiculous things. He's just gonna tell the truth, the truth is-is very...you know, complicated, so we went over it carefully, and-and just so we wouldn't leave anything up to chance or Michael's judgment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Could we please pull over and pull down the top, I do not feel good.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael, I told you, I am not putting the top down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm getting car sick! Ugh, I'm gonna puke. I think I'm gonna throw up.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: All right, fine, just a second. Hold on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey, Schneider, real quick. What do you call a butt load of lawyers driving off a cliff?

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: A good start. And I think it's busload.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, a bunch of rich lawyers took the bus. [To Jan] Where did you find this guy? Hey, there he is.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey hey.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: I'm glad you're here. I actually need to talk to you for a second.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Could we talk off the record? As friends?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I would love that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Jan... has put the company in a very tough position here. Now you've been with us for a long time. Over 10 years, right? We just want to be sure that you won't do anything to hurt us with your testimony. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Abso-fruitley. Yeah. I'll-I'll do anything for the company.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: Good. That is great to hear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It is.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: [playing ping-pong] Game, son!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right, let's run it back.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: The warehouse got a ping pong table last week. Now Jim comes down and plays with Darryl. Sometimes I bring him juice. My boyfriend is 12.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What has two skinny chicken legs and sucks at ping pong?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Guess whose boyfriend it is?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't wanna guess.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I'll give you a hint: It's not my boyfriend. I think it's a guy over here [points to Jim].

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I don't talk trash, I talk smack. They're totally different. Trash talk is hypothetical, like: Your mom is so fat she can eat the internet. But smack talk is happening like right now. Like: You're ugly and I know it for a fact so I got the evidence right there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim. Can I see you for a second?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, it's not regulation size, but it'll do. You have to practice. You have to get real good and beat Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, I can't beat Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Please? Kelly's trash talking me because Darryl is beating you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What, seriously? What is she saying?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [flashback, to Pam] Your boyfriend is so weak, he needs steroids just to watch baseball.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [flashback, to Pam] Jim couldn't hit a ping pong ball if it was the size of the moon.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [flashback, to Pam] Were Jim's parents first cousins that were also bad at ping pong?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So you're asking me to defend your honor against Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sorta, yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Bring me players.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Hi everyone, I'm Diane Kelly. I'm the company's chief legal counsel.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hi. [Michael sees Toby] No, no, absolutely not. What is he doing here?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Toby?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Are you renewing your divorce vows, before my deposition?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Michael, I'm your HR Rep. I'm on your side.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Never. I want him gone. I don't talk until he leaves.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael, just relax, okay?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: You know, I think they're, uh ready for us now. So..

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. All right.

quotes.speaker: Deposition Reporter
quotes.line: Mr. Scott. Do you swear to tell the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yessh.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Mr. Scott, can you describe the circumstances of Ms. Levinson's termination?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, it was not just termination. It was a pattern of disrespect and inappropriate behavior.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Oh. Very good. Well put.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: People underestimate Michael. There are plenty of things that he is well above average at. Like ice skating. He is a very good ice skater.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hey, Kevin. Jim needs to see you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: About what?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He needs help balancing some travel receipts.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Are you sure he wants me? Because I have Oscar balance my travel receipts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, no, he asked for you specifically. He's in the conference room.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [enters conference room and sees ping pong table] Oh, awesome! [Pam puts "Meeting in Progress" sign on the door]

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: How long have you known the plaintiff?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I haven't actually seen it. But I have seen the firm, and I am planning on renting The Pelican Brief

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: How long have you known Ms. Levinson?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Six years and two months.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: And you were directly under her the entire time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Ms. Levinson told you she was your direct superior?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh, wh-why would she say that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Can we just move on to another question?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: No wait, I don't understand. Who's on record on saying this?

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: With all due respect, I'm in the middle of a line of questioning. Now Mr. Scott, what did you say Ms. Levinson said? Regarding your employment status with respect to her corporate position.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Come again? That's what she said? I don't know what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Okay, if I may, he was just telling a joke before, so can we move on to another question?

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Oh, are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Uh, yes.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Can you go back to where this digression began?

quotes.speaker: Deposition Reporter
quotes.line: [reading off paper] Mr. Schneider: And you were directly under her the entire time? Mr. Scott: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, delivery is all wrong. She's butchering it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [Pam leaving bathroom, Kelly entering, awkward moment, Pam steps aside to let Kelly in] Yeah, that's what I thought.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Did Ms. Levinson ever say why she thought she was being fired?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She thought it had to do with the twins. That's what I call them.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Can you be more specific? Who are the twins?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Um, to be delicate, they hang off milady's chest. They... make milk.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: You don't need to go any further. Her breasts.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: She thought it had something to do with her recent breast enhancement surgery?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes, and frankly, the timing was nothing short of predominant.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: What about your romantic relationship with Ms. Levinson? Could that have played a part in her termination?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, if it did, then the company is breaking its own rules.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Interesting. How so?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Because before we started dating, we disclosed our relationship to HR. And I have the proof right here. [makes a gasping sound]

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Okay, the company has just a few clarifying questions, Mr. Scott, if that's okay with you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I will allow it.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Um would you mind please just, uh, taking a quick look at, uh, this photograph please. [Diane hands Michael the photo of Jan and Michael in Jamaica]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: That is you and Ms. Levinson in Jamaica, is that correct?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: And that photograph was taken more than two months prior to this start of your relationship. Does that sound right? Mr. Scott, the timeline here is actually very important. Please, when did your relationship actually begin?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ugh. Well, de-depends on how you define "begin". I mean, if it was from the first time we shook hands, that's like six years ago. If it's from the first time we kissed, that's like two years ago.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Wait, excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If it was the first time we kissed sober, it was like four months after that.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Could we take a short break?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: No, uh, are you telling me that your relationship began two years ago and not in February as you previously testified to here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Line.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: I'm sorry, what?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: He asked for a line, like in a play.

quotes.speaker: Deposition Reporter
quotes.line: [reading off paper] "Mr. Scott, do you realize you just contradicted yourself?" "I did?" "Yes you did." "Can I go to the bathroom?" "No." "I really have to, I've been drinking lots of water." "You went five minutes ago." "That wasn't to go to the bathroom, that was to get out of a question." "You still have to answer it." "First can I go to the bathroom?" "No."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good game Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Don't patronize me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All right! What is going on here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight! Thank God you're here. As it turns out, one of our biggest clients is a ping pong master, and I have to play him tomorrow, or we lose the account. Can you help me out? Will you help me practice?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Dwight and Jim are playing ping-pong, and Dwight scores] What the hell?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I told you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: All of my heroes are table tennis players. Zoran Primorac, Jan-Ove Waldner, Wang Tao, J�rg Ro�kopf,  and of course Ashraf Helmi. I even have a life size poster of Hugo Hoyama on my wall. And the first time I left Pennsylvania was to go the hall of fame induction ceremony of Andrzej Grubba.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Jan and I had an off again, on again relationship for two years. And I know this destroys her case, and I am sorry, but I throw myself at the mercy of the deposition.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Thank you, Mr. Scott. That's all we needed to know.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Wait, we'd like to enter to the record a page from Michael Scott's personal journal.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Whoa whoa whoa whoa! What are you doing with my diary?

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: This is plaintiff's exhibit 107. I quote from an entry dated Janruary 4 of this past year. "Just got back from Jamaica. Tan almost everywhere. Jan almost everywhere. Hehe. Oh diary, what a week. I had sex with my boss. I don't know if it's going to go anywhere. Jan was very specific that this is not going anywhere, that it was a one time mistake. But we had sex six times so you tell me. I am definitely feeling very eerie."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Irie.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Irie, sorry. "More tomorrow. xoxo, Michael." It would appear, that neither you nor Ms. Levinson considered you had a relationship in any sense of the word. Is that correct?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: We're gonna need to see a copy of that entire journal before we proceed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't think anyone in this room has the right to read my diary.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: It's basic discovery. We have the right to review it.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: OK, let's make ten copies of this diary.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Um, can you make it eleven?

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Eleven, sure. And we'll break for lunch, so everyone can have a look.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [looking for a place to sit, goes to Toby's table] Can I sit here?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [nods] ...You know, I, uh, I know a little about what you're going through in a way. Um, when I was a kid, my parents got divorced. They both wanted custody, and they both asked me to testify against the other one in court. So, I don't know, I didn't want them getting divorced in the first place you know? I loved them both so much. I just wanted... [Michael pushes Toby's food tray off the table and walks off]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How can you give up my diary like that?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I had to, I'm sorry but I need to win this. We need to win this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How'd you even find it?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: You keep it under my side of the mattress.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't like lump. I'm really upset about this.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Alright, I stole your diary and gave it to my lawyer. You emailed a topless photo of me to everyone in our company. Let's call it even.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Fine. I love you.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: I love you too.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: [looking at a copy of Michael's diary] Mr. Scott, who is this other woman, Ryan? Who you refer to her as "Just as hot as Jan, but in a different way."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Not a woman, just a cool, great looking, best friend.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Aren't we trying to determine whether Michael or Jan were engaged in a romantic affair? Not Michael and this Ryan person.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: [laughs out loud] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright, alright. This is the way I see it. Yes, I had sex with Jan, and yes, I did consider Jan to be my girlfriend. However, Jan clearly didn't consider me to be her boyfriend. So her actions are completely rightful.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: OK Mr. Scott, it's, it's admirable the way you defend a woman who is so obviously ambivalent about her relationship with you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you very much. You didn't have to say that.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Considering she consistently gave you such poor performance reviews.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That was before our relationship. She was going through a divorce, and she was drinking a lot... [Jan glares at Michael] ...of water.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Mr. Scott, this is a copy of a particularly negative performance review. Would you mind, uh, reading the date on that please? [slides the performance review towards Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: March 17th.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: And that would be a month after your relationship became official, is that correct?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: You may read the, uh, highlighted portion out loud if you'd like to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [reading the performance review] "I am out of carrots. I am out of sticks. Mr. Scott has time and again proven himself to be an unmanageable employee, and a poor branch manager. I recommend he be removed from that position and re-assigned to sales where he belongs."

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Mr. Scott, after hearing that wouldn't you say Ms. Levinson's judgment is, at least, very seriously flawed?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [stares at Diane, eyes tearing up]

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Mr. Scott?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [walks in the conference room where Jim and Dwight are playing ping-pong] How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, he has gone from completely hopeless to simply miserable.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Check this out though, spin serve. [serves, and Dwight scores] Well, it works like 80% of the time, so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nice. So, should I reschedule the rematch with Darryl now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think I'm ready.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'll make the call.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Wait a minute, Darryl is the client? ...No, no, no. He works here, dumbass.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...Right. Spin-serve! [serves, and Dwight scores]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: How can you do that to me?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: [looks at Lester]

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: You can respond, just remember it's all going into the record.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Michael, I am not the enemy, OK? Dunder Mifflin is the enemy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dunder Mifflin has always treated me with the utmost respect, with loyalty. They were going to give me your job and I should have taken it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Alright, wait. Before you go any further, let me show you what kind of loyalty they have, OK? Lester, please read that part of Wallace's deposition.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Starting at paragraph 6. Council: "Mr. Wallace, regarding Michael Scott, was he a contender to replace Jan Levinson?" David Wallace: "Yes."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: See? I was his number 1 contender. I was being groomed.

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: Council: "Was he your first choice?" David Wallace: "Michael Scott is a fine employee who has been with the company for many years."

quotes.speaker: Council
quotes.line: "Was he in the top 5 of contenders?" David Wallace: "What do you want me to say? Come on, he's a nice guy. There were many people that I considered." Council: "Was he seriously being considered for the corporate job?" David Wallace: "No."

quotes.speaker: Lester
quotes.line: I have one more question, Mr. Scott. Wouldn't you agree with Ms. Levinson that the company exhibits a pattern of disrespect toward its employees?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...Absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [watches Jim score in ping-pong against Darryl] Yes! Way to go. [looks at Kelly] See that?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, the floppy haired girl you date won a point.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: 19, serving 4. [serves and scores]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Woooh! Nice baby! Nice one! [starts singing] Hey, hey, you, you! I don't like your boyfriend! Cuz, cuz, cuz, cuz, cuz he sucks at ping-pong!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: You know what? I'm sick of this! Let's go, you and me!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Let's go. Pick up a paddle.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: OK. Bring it on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I am.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Think you can handle this?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: In my sleep.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: OK. Volley for serve, P. [serves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: O. [hits the ping-pong ball, and it hits the net] [serves] P.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: O. [hits the ping-pong ball, and it hits the net]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you want to go play on the table upstairs?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Michael. I am very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, hey no biggie. Just...

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: No, no, no, no, no. This was rough. We never meant for you to get caught in the middle of this. I'm very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [nods and shakes hands with David Wallace] Hey, David?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I think you're a nice guy too.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: Thanks, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why did I do it? I don't know. Jan said that it was because of the photo that she revealed the diary. But she already brought the diary with her to New York, so... You expect to get screwed by your company, but you never expect to get screwed by your girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [Driving with Jan in the car] What do you want to do for dinner?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: How about Chinese?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Sure trying to save some money... get something cheap.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: That was my cheap suggestion. Chinese was my cheap suggestion.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Do you fast food?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Fine, fast food's fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, where did you learn how to play?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Cambodia.  You?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: My friend's basement. All right, ready to start?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Let's do this thing. [Creed loses the first point, tosses his paddle on the table and starts taking off his shirt.  Jim retrieves the ball and looks back to see Creed with his shirt untucked and unbuttoned]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: We're not playing strip pong? [Jim shakes his head no]  Okay. [Creed picks up paddle]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I totally see that. [looking at spreadsheet]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Right. There, first...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I think that's the question that you had...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: It's a problem with the client.  I think, Jim...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah. [makes 'talking' gesture with her hand]  Jim, come on, we gotta get in there and practice.  Okay?  I'm not kidding!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Wow. [heads toward the conference room]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Now.  Get good work done.  Concentrate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: On your backhand. [Jim opens the conference room door and enters]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Booyah! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: [laughing] Thought we were playing for fun.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: No one paid me to say 'Booyah.'  Now pick up the ball.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: But it's closer to you.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [kicks ball toward Phyllis] Now it isn't.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What are you guys doing?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, we're in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh yeah, how long's this meeting going to last?  [Stanley mumbles, looking at his watch]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [calling in, unseen] I have next meeting!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I played a lot of pong growing up.  I spent a lot of time on cruise ships.  I'm also a monster snorkler.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay, you know what, this table's not regulation.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Good eye - it's an oval.  [Andy compares his arm length to his side of the conference table] You're measuring the table.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Do you know anything about physics?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Just serve.  Let's go. [hits one into net]  Dammit!  These balls are weighted weird, aren't they?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.  Get another one. [throws the offending ball at Jim, who takes another from his pocket]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Now, wait a minute.  You're not gonna punch a wall, or me, or anything like that if you don't win the point, are you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don't know! No, okay, just... serve!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I have some, uh, experience.  I, um, once had to testify in a traffic accident case.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Then you're an old hand at this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yes.  My testimony was actually very important, um, because the accident was my fault.  [To Toby] Tell Meredith I said it another time [Toby nods].

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Yes, Michael is going to be cross-examined today, which'll be very, very risky for me, nonetheless, not an easy decision to make, but it's a deposition.  It's not going to be in front of a judge.  And it's four million dollars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Before we continue, I would like to make an opening statement.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.line: Fine.  Please be brief.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [clears throat and stands] Ladies and gentlemen of... the... table.  I would just like to say what a joy it is for me to be here today, but frankly, at my age, it's a joy to be anywhere [no one laughs].  I'm only forty-four, so I'm not old, and I guess that doesn't really play.  But the point is, I have a sense of humor.   And I implore you all to have a sense of humor as well.  Jan, David, my wonderful girlfriend [indicates Jan, then turns to David Wallace], my gorgeous company... Why don't we all just take a big deep breath... and just relax [breathes in deeply, no one responds].  Good.  That feels good [sits].  All right.  Everybody feel better?

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Two years ago, when you quote "kissed and fondled in the Chili's parking lot" [Jan sighs and shakes her head], were you aware of company guidelines specifically discouraging that behavior?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Na, Na-oh, Naa-es.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, I'm sorry, that's not a word.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ye-ohh.  Ye-no.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Okay.  Were you aware that when Jan was with you, she claimed to be visiting clients, or, uh, traveling to see her sister in Scottsdale?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Very nice! [Borat voice]

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: I'm sorry.  Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: High five! [Borat voice]

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.line: Sometimes when he gets nervous he, uh, talks like Borat.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Okay, Mr. Scott, would you mind, um, speaking in your normal voice for us.  Please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [shakes head] Can't stop.

quotes.speaker: Diane Kelly
quotes.line: Okay [nods].

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Forgot normal talk.
